FW/1 3.0 RC 2 available

Framework One - is a family of small, lightweight, convention-over-configuration frameworks, primarily for CFML. FW/1 itself provides MVC, DI/1 provides dependency injection (a.k.a. inversion of control), and AOP/1 provides aspect-oriented programming features on top of DI/1.

Home Blog Documentation View on GitHub Download 4.2 (Current) Download 4.3 (Beta) RSS

About two weeks ago I released FW/1 3.0 RC 1 and the only real bug persisting at that point was related to DI/1 dotted path deduction.

I think that bug is finally squashed, based on early testing by some users that had encountered the bug, so the second Release Candidate build of FW/1 3.0 is now available!

In addition to fixing that DI/1 bug, the only other change since RC 1 is some cleanup of the examples folder. That means this RC is almost certainly going to be gold candidate for the final 3.0 release.

Please download and test this version and report any issues you find. Iâ€™d like to cut the final 3.0 release fairly soon, so I can merge develop to master and start planning FW/1 3.5.

Posted by Sean Corfield
